str2: And, even, also, namely.
(Hebrew), Levi, son of Alphaeus, the publican. A form of Leui; Lewis, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A feast, banquet, reception. From dechomai; a reception, i.e. Convivial entertainment.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
Much, many; often.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
A publican, collector of taxes. From telos and oneomai; a tax-farmer, i.e. Collector of public revenue.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
And, even, also, namely.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

str2: From kata and keimai; to lie down, i.e. be sick; specially, to recline at a meal.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
